report:
**Damage Report:**

**Vehicle:** [Vehicle Make and Model]

**Location of Damage:** Rear Quarter Panel

**Type of Damage:** Scratches

**Description:**
The rear quarter panel of the vehicle shows visible scratches near the taillight area. The scratches appear to be superficial and do not seem to penetrate the paint layer significantly. There is no indication of deeper damage such as dents or dings.

**Recommendation:**
Based on the observed scratches, it may be advisable to have the area professionally inspected by a body shop to determine if any underlying structural damage exists beneath the surface. If the scratches are minor and do not affect the structural integrity, they can typically be repaired with touch-up paint.

**Photographic Evidence:**
A close-up photograph of the rear quarter panel showing the scratches is attached for reference.

**Next Steps:**
1. Have the vehicle inspected by a qualified mechanic or body shop.
2. Document the extent of the damage for insurance purposes.
3. Coordinate with the insurance company to schedule repairs if necessary.

**Prepared By:**
[Your Name]  
Insurance Adjuster  
[Your Company]  
[Date]
